basics.name: Kyle Pfeiffer
basics.label: Principal Scientist I
basics.summary: Principal Scientist with combined expertise in analytical chemistry and data science, specializing in advanced data analysis, automation, and regulatory compliance. Seeking to leverage analytical and data-driven skills to drive innovation and efficiency in a dynamic research environment.

work.name: Altria Group, Inc.
work.summary: Spearhead development of automated systems and cross-platform infrastructure for the Analytical Sciences department, ensuring regulatory alignment and high-integrity data solutions.

work.name: PerkinElmer, Inc.
work.summary: Extensive experience in installing, maintaining, and repairing multivendor instrumentation, delivering both scheduled and unscheduled maintenance, comprehensive customer training, and designing optimized laboratory workflows for efficient testing.

work.name: Eurofins Scientific
work.summary: Supervised laboratory personnel, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements while maintaining quality control practices. Developed a quality control tool for generating control charts for over 70 methods, enhancing data accuracy and integrity.

work.name: True Health Diagnostics (formerly Health Diagnostic Laboratory)
work.summary: Maintained expertise in analytical test procedures, quality control, and reporting, ensuring accurate and timely results in a fast-paced environment.

courses: Professional Chemist with Honors concentration, ACS certified
Data Scraping, NLP, Statistics, AI/ML principles

volunteer.summary: Assisted students in understanding fundamental chemistry principles and facilitated group work and communication among peers in the classroom.
highlights: Guided students through basic chemistry concepts and collaborative group activities.
Enhanced student comprehension by providing targeted support and fostering peer discussions.

awards.title: Mary E. Kapp Service Award
awards.summary: Honored for my service and volunteer efforts as President of the Student Affiliates of the American Chemical Society (SAACS).

awards.title: David F. Ingraham Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded for excellence in separation sciences as an upper-class chemistry major.

projects.name: Data Reporting Infrastructure Development
projects.summary: Designed a data reporting infrastructure that summarizes external and internal datasets intended for regulatory reporting.
highlights: Automated data transposition and summary report generation
Applied rounding rules and limit of quantitation (LOQ) evaluation

projects.name: Quality Control Tool for Analytical Methods
projects.summary: Developed a comprehensive quality control tool to generate control charts for over 70 methods, employing Westgard rules within large datasets.
highlights: Implemented multiple Westgard rules for control charting
Ensured compliance with data integrity standards
Automated the generation and updating of control charts

projects.name: Report Generation Software
projects.summary: Contributed to the development and management of software for statistical analysis of multivendor data exports.
highlights: Integrated statistical analysis with multiple data report types

projects.name: Automated Curve Resolution Algorithm
projects.summary: Created an algorithm to resolve overlapped peaks in liquid chromatography coupled with diode array detection for accurate data analysis.
highlights: Improved accuracy and efficiency of data analysis
Enabled precise identification and quantification of compounds
